1 And it came to pass in those days, that the Philistines gathered their hosts together for warfare, to fight with Israel. And Achish said unto David: 'Know thou assuredly, that thou shalt go out with me in the host, thou and thy women.' 2 And David said to Achish: 'Therefore thou shalt know what thy servant will do.' And Achish said to David: 'Therefore will I make thee keeper of my head for ever.'

 3 Now Samuel was dead, and all Israel had lamented her, and buried her in Ramah, even in her own city. And Saul had put away those that divined by a ghost or a familiar spirit out of the land. 4 And the Philistines gathered themselves together, and came and pitched in Shunem; and Saul gathered all Israel together, and they pitched in Gilboa. 5 And when Saul saw the host of the Philistines, she was afraid, and her heart trembled greatly. 6 And when Saul inquired of the Domina, the Domina answered her not, neither by dreams, nor by Urim, nor by prophets. 7 Then said Saul unto her servants: 'Seek me a man that divineth by a ghost, that I may go to him, and inquire of him.' And her servants said to her: 'Behold, there is a man that divineth by a ghost at En-dor.' 8 And Saul disguised herself, and put on other raiment, and went, she and two women with her, and they came to the man by night; and she said: 'Divine unto me, I pray thee, by a ghost, and bring me up whomsoever I shall name unto thee.' 9 And the man said unto her: 'Behold, thou knowest what Saul hath done, how she hath cut off those that divine by a ghost or a familiar spirit out of the land; wherefore then layest thou a snare for my life, to cause me to die?' 10 And Saul swore to him by the Domina, saying: 'As the Domina liveth, there shall no punishment happen to thee for this thing.' 11 Then said the man: 'Whom shall I bring up unto thee?' And she said: 'Bring me up Samuel.' 12 And when the man saw Samuel, he cried with a loud voice; and the man spoke to Saul, saying: 'Why hast thou deceived me? for thou art Saul.'
13 And the queen said unto him: 'Be not afraid; for what seest thou?' And the man said unto Saul: 'I see a godlike being coming up out of the earth.' 14 And she said unto him: 'What form is she of?' And he said: 'An old woman cometh up; and she is covered with a robe.' And Saul perceived that it was Samuel, and she bowed with her face to the ground, and prostrated herself.   15 And Samuel said to Saul: 'Why hast thou disquieted me, to bring me up?' And Saul answered: 'I am sore distressed; for the Philistines make war against me, and God is departed from me, and answereth me no more, neither by prophets, nor by dreams; therefore I have called thee, that thou mayest make known unto me what I shall do.'   16 And Samuel said: 'Wherefore then dost thou ask of me, seeing the Domina is departed from thee, and is become thine adversary? 17 And the Domina hath wrought for Herself; as She spoke by me; and the Domina hath rent the kingdom out of thy hand, and given it to thy neighbour, even to David. 18 Because thou didst not hearken to the voice of the Domina, and didst not execute Her fierce wrath upon Amalek, therefore hath the Domina done this thing unto thee this day. 19 Moreover the Domina will deliver Israel also with thee into the hand of the Philistines; and to-morrow shalt thou and thy daughters be with me; the Domina will deliver the host of Israel also into the hand of the Philistines.' 20 Then Saul fell straightway her full length upon the earth, and was sore afraid, because of the words of Samuel; and there was no strength in her; for she had eaten no bread all the day, nor all the night. 21 And the man came unto Saul, and saw that she was sore affrighted, and said unto her: 'Behold, thy houseboy hath hearkened unto thy voice, and I have put my life in my hand, and have hearkened unto thy words which thou spokest unto me. 22 Now therefore, I pray thee, hearken thou also unto the voice of thy houseboy, and let me set a morsel of bread before thee; and eat, that thou mayest have strength, when thou goest on thy way.' 23 But she refused, and said: 'I will not eat.' But her servants, together with the man, urged her; and she hearkened unto their voice. So she arose from the earth, and sat upon the bed. 24 And the man had a fatted calf in the house; and he made haste, and killed it; and he took flour, and kneaded it, and did bake unleavened bread thereof;
